Sam's TNR, Inc.

Helping community cats in Barney and northern Brooks County, Georgia through Trap-Neuter-Return

Our Mission

Sam's TNR, Inc. is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization dedicated to humanely reducing the community cat population in Barney and northern Brooks County, Georgia through Trap-Neuter-Return (TNR). We work tirelessly to improve the lives of community cats while creating healthier neighborhoods for everyone.

250+

Community Cats Spayed/Neutered & Vaccinated

Why TNR?

üêæ

Population Control

TNR is the most humane and effective method for managing community cat populations. By spaying and neutering, we prevent new litters and gradually reduce colony sizes.

üí∞

Cost-Effective

TNR costs significantly less than repeated rounds of trapping and removing cats. It's a one-time investment that provides lasting results for communities.

üèòÔ∏è

Community Benefits

Neutered cats are quieter, less aggressive, and don't spray. TNR reduces nuisance behaviors while keeping familiar community cats in their home territories.

‚úÖ

Proven Success

Studies across the country have shown that TNR programs effectively stabilize and reduce community cat populations over time, with measurable results.

Our Services

ü™§

Trap

We use humane box traps to safely capture community cats. Our experienced volunteers ensure cats are handled with care and minimal stress throughout the trapping process.

ü©∫

Neuter/Spay & Vaccinate

Trapped cats are transported to licensed veterinarians for spay/neuter surgery and rabies vaccination. Each cat receives an ear tip ‚Äî the universal sign of a TNR cat.

üè°

Return

After recovery, cats are returned to their original location where community caretakers continue to provide food and monitor their health. They live out their lives in familiar territory.

Frequently Asked Questions

Support Our Mission

Sam's TNR, Inc. is a registered 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization. Your generous donations help us continue our mission of humanely managing community cat populations through Trap-Neuter-Return. Every dollar goes directly toward spay/neuter surgeries, vaccinations, and supplies.

All donations are tax-deductible to the extent allowed by law.
